content: Looks like GitHub is adding an integrated workflow similar to bors. Looks promising.
we're already in contact with github about it!
(and other cool features they released lately)

Pietro Albini said:

(and other cool features they released lately)

Oh? Which ones?
@Pietro Albini does that mean we could stop maintaining bors at some point?
if it works well for us maybe?
we don't have access yet so it might not do everything we need right now

Josh Triplett said:

Pietro Albini said:

(and other cool features they released lately)

Oh? Which ones?

the three that come to mind are:

  • on github actions support for openid connect auth with aws (to replace persistent credentials)
  • role-based access control custom roles (we might finally be able to stop giving everyone write access to rust-lang/rust just because they need to edit issue comments) (enterprise-only, but we're on enterprise cloud)
  • verified domains for github pages (we had people in the past squatting $something.rust-lang.org on github pages)
We're on Enterprise Cloud? I didn't realize that.
since like a year ago by now?
that's why we actually have enough concurrent capacity on github actions
